alert.note: Alert for Greene (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:29AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Choctaw, north central Monroe, Washington, Clarke, southwestern Wilcox and northeastern Greene Counties through 115 AM CST... At 1229 AM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Putnam to Coffeeville to near Chatom to 9 miles north of Leakesville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Thomasville, Grove Hill, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Whatley, Tibbie, State Line, Fruitdale, Coffeeville, Fulton and Yellow Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southeastern Mississippi.
